headline: Baked Kale Chips
description: This easy recipe for baked kale chips is simply the best. With only 3 ingredients, the kale chips turn out perfectly crispy and are a great homemade snack.

video.description: Craving crunchy snacks but trying to keep it healthy? These crispy oven-baked kale chips are the perfect veggie option. This video shows you how to make kale chips with three simple ingredients: fresh kale, olive oil, and flaked sea salt.
video.name: Baked Kale Chips Recipe

name: Baked Kale Chips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
With a knife or kitchen shears carefully remove kale leaves from the thick stems and tear into bite size pieces.
Wash and thoroughly dry kale with a salad spinner.
Drizzle kale leaves with olive oil and toss to combine. Spread out in an even layer on the baking sheet without overlapping and sprinkle with salt.
Bake until the edges start to brown but are not burnt, 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: EASY, QUICK, DELICIOUS AND HEALTHY!!
Definitely needs to be completely dry before baking. I did 250 degrees at 25 minutes and it came out pretty good.
I also added flax seeds and nutritional yeast and used my hydrator.
The time and temperature way off. I checked at 15 minutes and my chips were already brown ☹️ Was so bummed.
I am just not a kale fan. It tastes ok and my kitchen smells like kale. Didn't turn me into a kale fan.
time consuming but worth it!
I made it as directed and it was delicious! I’m making it again today. It’s crispy, has a wonderful flavor, and better, I think, than any other form of kale.
Love kale chips and my kids do too! You do have to keep a close eye though because even a minute too long can burn them but it's a wonderful and delicious way to enjoy kale!

Geez I love these, which i refer to as crisps (I feel like "chips" are thicker). I followed the instructions and baked at 300 °F, BUT I baked mine for 15 minutes and they were perfectly crispy, not burned, and completely yummy! I have a Maytag gas oven, so I had to do the chips/crisps in 4 batches due to lack of oven space. Of note there were a few kale leaf shreds that were maybe "soft" while everything else was crispy due to density of leaf curliness, but don't worry. As it cools, it crisps up. But be mindful: these are so tasty and easy to eat that they go fast!
No changes, just stored extra in Mylar bag and they lasted for a while. Even my husband ate these.
If you follow the tips, these turn out great! I added extra seasonings after baking like smoked paprika and garlic powder which added a little zip to the flavor.

I had some wilted kale but not rotten. I made chips from them, and they turned out well. I dried my leaves by pressing them with 2 towels and spread them in one layer. Twenty minutes was a good enough cooking time. I used sunflower oil (what I had) and they were tasty. Olive oil might be a little tastier, but I liked it. The taste of the kale is a little weird, but it was good. The texture is brittle, and they crumble easily into dust.

My first time doing kale chips and they were pretty good. 20 mins cooking time. No burned edges. Very crispy. I drizzled them with oil in my salad spinner and kneaded and tossed them with my hands. Then I spun them. This way they were all completely lightly covered with oil. Next time I will cut smaller pieces as they did not shrink very much. And I will use less salt.
Perfect! Very tasty!!
Wonderful, perfectly done.
They came out perfectly crispy! Must dry well first.

I am SO glad I didn't set the timer for the recommended amount of time! At 7 minutes, smoke began to come out of the oven! I saved the chips because I was standing right there & could get them out of the oven. Tasty chips.
Turned out great! I used season salt for additional flavor. They turned out crispy but not burnt.

I've never had Kale before and a friend told me to make Kale chips. Yum! I added some Cranberry and Raspberry balsamic vinegar to the olive oil then sprinkled salt and a little bit of Slap Ya Mama cajun seasoning. Double delicious! Now I wish there was a way to store Kale chips all year long!

Great recipe. I dislike the taste of kale, raw & cooked, but this recipe for baked kale chips has converted me to a fan. Easy to make by following the recipe details. I used Himalayan sea salt & dry ranch powder. They came out light & crispy & pretty much melt in your mouth. My family likes them too.
I really liked these the last time I made them. I got cocky and didn't look at the recipe this time. Word of warning: 450° for 20 minutes is too hot for too long.

Wow! I'm terrible at cooking and this turned out amazing!!! Easy to make and tastes very good. I was trying to figure out how to make something with kale since a fridge won't fit in my car when traveling. This should work. I'm excited to not have to give up kale during road trips. Thanks for the recipe!
Super quick and easy. Absolutely delicious.
it was delesh

I make these every other night for a snack, I put parm from the container and bake at 300 for 7 minutes. I bought the wrong item last week, thought it baby kale and it was baby arugula and it was Awesome also and spinach also works.
First time ever trying kale chips and did not have high hopes. I used popcorn seasoning salt (garlic and Parmesan) and was ABSOLUTELY blown away!! Now I’m just wishing I made more!
I baked @ 300° for 20 minutes then turned oven off and let sit ten more minutes in the oven and they turned out perfect, just as suggested by another reviewer.
Prefectly crisp! I added onion and garlic powder and covered my cookie sheet with tin foil rather than parchment. You must blot the leaves dry prior to baking otherwise they steam. Love it! Yum!
It was great! Pretty easy too!
I loved these! I added a bit of cavenders for extra flavor. I make these to eat with my bell pepper sandwiches. However, when I stored them, they got soggy any suggestion on how to keep them crunchy?

Followed the advice of another reviewer and turned the oven down to 300 and cooked for 20min. then turned oven off and let it sit for another 10 min. Also, put torn kale in a bowl and tossed quite a bit to coat evenly with oil, spread in an even layer in cookie sheet and sprinkled with seasoned salt ( much less than 1 tsp) from up high. These were so good!!!

These are delicious and easy to make. I wash ahead of time and let dry thoroughly. Coat them well with oil and sprinkle liberally with Maldonado sea salt. I cook about 7 minutes on each side. My husband is not a lover of kale but he LOVES these. This is my go-to recipe now for kale
Made it for my wife as a snack, due to her being on a Keto diet. She loves it.....I'm happy I'll take a photo next time Bob
It was good

Turned out perfect - so crispy! I used my fingers to coat each individual piece of kale with olive oil before placing on the tray and adding salt. Oven (convectional) set to 175C for 10 mins each batch.

Super easy and yum.

I put oven on air fry 350 and put on baking sheet with holes for 7 minutes.

Does smoke a lot though.
It's so good, I used garlic salt instead of sea salt
the recipe is really good

I love it!! I was dying for a crunchy / salty / snacky something that wouldn't blow my low carb diet - this is it!! You can demolish a bowl of this in front of the TV and not feel guilty! This is a keeper.
Loved this recipe! Thank you!

I followed this recipe to a tee and based on the descriptions in the reviews, it turned out as designed. The recipe instructions were clear and easy to follow but the end product was too delicate to be considered "chips". The only practical use may be sprinkling over an already cooked casserole or sprinkled on a smoothies that needs salt. Won't be making this again.

What a great way to make charcoal! Kale chips need to be cooked low and slow. It's been a while since I made these, so I figured I'd give this a try and my suspicions were confirmed. I ended up with a bunch of burnt leaves.

Baking time and temp likely depend on one's oven. Ten minutes at 350º was not long enough in mine. Fifteen was perhaps a tad too long. More of the kale turned brown at 15 mins, and I don't like the burnt flavor that results. But it's all personal preference. In all, a solid basic recipe. Not to mention, so much more economical than buying kale chips in the grocery store. I recently priced one 2 oz. bag at $39.99 a pound. Yowzah!
Perfect! I added sesame seeds! So good.

I've used this recipe about 10 times in the last week (yes, I've actually made multiple batches in a day!) and these are AMAZING. The whole family loves them. 350 is definitely the perfect temperature, and I just take them out when they're sizzling and feel crispy. (Someone had a great tip - try to lay the curly side down, so you get good air flow on both sides of the leaf/chip). Also, I've been using garlic salt in place of regular salt - highly recommend. I just rip the leaves, rinse them, then toss in a large bowl with some tongs in olive oil and garlic salt before laying on the baking sheet and they come out ~PERFECT~ every time.
These were fantastic! I did, however, have to bake for 20 minutes to get them perfect. But overall, I give it a 10/10. ??

This is the second time I made these, both times in an air fryer. They were/are delicious. Took about 5 minutes at 375 in the air fryer, just make sure you give it a good shake once or twice. My next batch will be with soy sauce as one suggested. I'd take a photo but I ate them all...sorry!
Easy peasy to make and delicious. Cook times vary dramatically but once it was done I enjoyed them very much!
delish
Loved it as is. Both my husband and son ate it and asked for more!
so delicious. i was lazy and just sprayed mine with pam and sprinkled with popcorn salt and garlic powder. oh darn!... hubby didnt like them. guess I'll have to eat them all.
I made these and oh my they are delicious. better than anything you can buy out of a bag. Try them and they are so reasonable to make.
Didn't think I would like these, but they kept me coming back for more. Will be making again!
Took 15 minutes on convection with 2 sheets
Can't believe it.
Great, simple recipe. Only thing to watch is the salt--I might halve that next time.
It was super easy to make and it turned out super yummy!
Very light and tasty! Good way to use up leftover fresh kale you might have in your fridge.

My wife wasn’t the biggest fan, but I loved it. What I did to get her to like it was after 5 minutes in the oven I sprinkled fine grated quality cheddar over the top and put them back in. I checked them after 5 minutes and started pulling out the chips that were done. I set a timer for 2 minutes and continually pulled out the chips as the finished. With a little cheese these are so addicting we couldn’t get enough.
Super and so easy, thanks! I made it again a couple days later--do be sure your leaves are dry though before baking, as the 2nd time I had some pieces that came out wilty and wet.
I used prewashed, chopped kale and I used olive oil spray, Mr. Dash and Himalayan salt. SO Good!!
I tried. Not a good conversation topic.
quick, easy and tasty
Perfectly crispy, not too dry!!

I love it, :P, when I looked at the picture at first I thought it was not that crispy but when I tried it I was so amazed, it was crunchy and you didn't even taste the bitterness of the kale. You just need to put the kale evenly on the baking dish. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F for 11 minuets and the crispiness will be perfect.
Crispy and perfect. I used Everything But The Bagel seasoning, extra ground tri-color pepper, and freshly grated parmesan. Fantastic.
These were perfect! I used Johnny's Seasoning Salt. It's a local Washington favorite.
Yes I

Made sure that the kale was dry after washing and kept on low heat while stirring to eliminate any moisture. 
Was fabulous as I used toasted sesame oil and garlic. They didn’t make it off the baking sheet!

If you have issues with irregular baking or chips not being crispy you didn’t do it right. Make sure at the kale pieces are small, washed and dried completely and put on very low in the oven while stirring periodically
Will make these again; super easy and surprisingly crunchy!
They were simple to make and so yummy! A way better pig out then a bag of potato chips

So excited to have kids excited about kale, from growing it in our garden and tending to it right up to harvesting, cleaning, drying, baking and snacking. In our oven, 300 degrees for about 12 minutes works great.

Super easy recipe. I used a small amount of seasoning salt and will cut back on the salt next time. Delicious!

12.5 minutes was perfect for most of my pieces. Some of the bigger pieces are a little chewy but they are still yummy.
The kale chips are always perfecly crispy, but depending on what kin of seasoned salt you use, 1 tsp. can be too salty. I usually end up using about 1/4 tsp.

I might rate these higher if I had a better experience with cooking them. 

First, Kale definitely has a taste that you need to get used to. I'm pretty sure this is something I would get used to fairly quickly (and like) if I had made these properly. 

Second, If I make these again, I will change two things: 1.) don't load up the baking sheet with every piece of cut kale from the branches you bought from the store (I guess I was thinking I could squeeze them all in on two baking sheets). While there was no kale on top of one another, they were definitely densely populated! 2.) I was NOT a good "Sprinkler" of the oil! Some places on the sheet had TOO much oil. Because of these two factors, the kale baked unevenly. I had to bake it longer than indicated on the recipe to get them crunchy. I didn't burn any of them but some of them were soggy. 

In all, I ate the ones that were crunchy and threw out most of it that was soggy either due to my over populating the pan or the excess oil. 

I think I would really like them if I cooked them right.
Bitter and a bit empty like eating air.

Followed recipe exactly. Was watching closely for the first 5 minutes. Walked away for 2 minutes and came back to burnt chips. Next time will decrease the temp and check them outside the oven at 5 minutes.
Great recipe! The olive oil and salt touch was delicious! I’m thirteen and I made them and by brothers approved! My 3 year old brother LOVED IT!!!!!! I cooked around 8-9 minutes though

You don’t need a lot of oil for this. Use a tiny bit and work through the leaves with your hands. Feel free to make several batches with this. Bags of kale from the store that are usually intentioned for smoothies are great for this. And you don’t need to be very meticulous about the spreading of the kale - just make sure all pieces are touching the pan.

These turned out beautifully. I don’t use oil, so I dried them with a towel and then while they were slightly damp, I sprinkled nutritional yeast and some Benson’s Table Tasty seasoning. My oven seems to cook faster so I set the timer for 13 minutes. They came out perfectly!
I baked with "baby kale" and added sea salt and Yeast Flakes. Baked for about 15 min until brown. VERY good and SO easy.
We made a different recipe before and the kids weren't big fans. This time they liked it better!
Quick, easy and very tasty!
One of the best snacks ever! I use Chipotle infused olive oil most of the time. They are just hot enough to be very interesting. I love these chips.

I got a bunch of curly kale in my market box. I wanted to use it up and haven’t made chips in a long time. I looked it up and found this recipe. Seasoned with Penzey’s Mural of Flavor. Perfect! (I had to add two minutes in our oven, not uncommon) And now I’m going to probably sit here and eat the whole batch. Yum!!!

It is tricky to get the right level of crispness without charring the thinner leaves. You can avoid this if you check the tray once in a while during baking to mix the leaves and remove the crisped ones to allow the thicker leaves bake longer.
Great just like it reads...sometimes in bunch is large, I have to use more oil and I cut the salt down a little

Good timing and temp, too much salt though. I dusted mine with fine salt as soon as they came out of the oven.
Tips:
1. Make sure kale is DRY before you start.
2. Dont over oil. Just a teaspoon or so is enough, and rub the kale between your fingers to distribute oil evenly. 
3. Spread kale leaves out on parchment paper coated pan so they aren't folded and leave lots of space between leaves for air circulation.
4. Set timer for 5 min, check
5. Set for another 5. Move trays around if using multiple, and turn all kale leaves over once
6. Set for another 5 and watch very carefully. You want crispy, but not burned. A tiny bit of brownish around the edges is ok

It was very good, I added a bit of white pepper.
One has to be very careful not to overbake, the leaves burn very easily

This was very easy to make. I used fresh organic kale from the farmer’s market. I lightly drizzled half with Meyer lemon olive oil and half with garlic olive oil and I topped both halves with a touch of garlic salt. 15 mins of baking was just right for a light, crispy snack. Thanks for the recipe!
Healthy Addictive snack
Added garlic....
Would have given this a 5 but I found them WAY to salty with a whole teaspoon of salt. Next time I will use like 1/2 or even a 1/4 of the amount.
Who knew kale could be good, much less irresistible! wow!
so yummy
These were fantastic. Made exactly as directed using kosher salt instead of seasoning. My 12yo who will not eat vegetables at a whole pan full herself!
Yep I like these. Easy and addicting.

I added a little bit of freeze dried shallots, black pepper and used sesame oil mixed with olive oil and sprinkled sesame seeds over the seasoned oiled greens. It’s Asian inspired and yummy. I’d make them again - wait making a second batch currently with just salt and EVO.
Mix halfway through for even crispiness. I lowered the temp to 300 and baked for 25-30 minutes for evenness.
